channel.title: Home on Boris Lebedenko
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Boris Lebedenko

item.title: I absolutely LOVE Rmarkdown!!!
item.description: Rmarkdown is amazing. Plain and simple. One of the best free software packages in the world.

item.title: The correlation matrix - a pragmatic perspective
item.description: The problem: Man, why isn’t there a one line command to see the correlation in the data? — Some social sciences dude Why is it a problem? Well, obviously the problem lies in the word correlation. Every 2nd year student can tell you that what is referred to is actually association, and that its measure depends on the type of variables at hand - nominal, ordinal, interval or scale.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Being passionate about data in science and the science of data, I assume the role of a data-detective when hired: I conduct a thorough investigation to uncover the truth hidden within, while also doing the regular “police” work (cleaning, wrangling, etc.) on the data. I can guarantee exceptional performance without compromising rigor in the following fields: Statistical modeling and inference - biostatitics, stochastic processes. R - data analysis, package development, shiny apps.

item.title: Consulting
item.description: I am self-employed in statistical consulting. I am available for any inquiry about data and statistics. Some selected consulting projects include: Valentin’s shiny app and paper. Sagi’s paper. Meital’s paper. LEAN study.(?)
